summary: This document is the Last Will and Testament of Jeffrey E. Epstein, outlining the distribution of his estate, the appointment of executors, and the powers granted to them. It details the responsibilities of the executors and the management of his estate, including provisions for compensation and the handling of assets. This document is the Last Will and Testament of Jeffrey E. Epstein, outlining the distribution of his estate and the roles of the Executor and Trustee. It includes provisions regarding taxes and the handling of assets after his death.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein

persons.name: Darren K. Indyke
persons.context: Darren K. Indyke is appointed as one of the executors of Epstein's will, responsible for managing the estate according to the will's provisions.

persons.name: Richard D. Kahn
persons.context: Richard D. Kahn is appointed as one of the executors of Epstein's will, tasked with overseeing the estate's administration.

persons.name: Kathryn H. Ruemmler
persons.context: Kathryn H. Ruemmler is appointed as a successor executor in case the primary executors are unable or unwilling to serve.

connections.description: Jeffrey E. Epstein appoints Darren K. Indyke as an executor of his estate, indicating a professional relationship.
Jeffrey E. Epstein appoints Richard D. Kahn as an executor of his estate, indicating a professional relationship.
Darren K. Indyke and Richard D. Kahn are both appointed as executors of Epstein's will, working together to manage the estate.
Kathryn H. Ruemmler is designated as a successor executor to Darren K. Indyke, indicating a hierarchical relationship.
Kathryn H. Ruemmler is designated as a successor executor to Richard D. Kahn, indicating a hierarchical relationship.

locations: St. Thomas, United States Virgin Islands
keyFacts: Jeffrey E. Epstein revokes all prior wills and codicils with this document.
Darren K. Indyke and Richard D. Kahn are appointed as executors, with Kathryn H. Ruemmler as a successor executor.
The executors are entitled to a compensation of $250,000 each upon completion of probate.
The will outlines extensive powers for the executors regarding the management and distribution of the estate.
The document specifies that no bond or security is required of any executor.
The document is a Last Will and Testament executed by Jeffrey E. Epstein on January 18, 2019.
It outlines the roles of the Executor and Trustee in managing the estate and the distribution of assets.
Provisions are included regarding the apportionment of federal and state taxes related to the estate.
The Will states that any bequest to an individual who does not survive Epstein shall lapse.
The document was witnessed and notarized, confirming its validity.
